prompt: A large, ancient banyan tree standing near an Indian village, sprawling roots, thick green leaves, peaceful rural landscape. Children's storybook illustration.
A black crow perched on a branch of the giant banyan tree, looking around. The village is visible in the distance. Vibrant colors, storybook style.
The crow on the branch, looking clever but slightly lazy, wings tucked in, relaxed posture. Soft sunlight filtering through leaves. Illustrative style.
A field below the banyan tree with a pigeon (kabootar) walking around. The pigeon looks hardworking and focused. Rural background, soft colors.
The pigeon picking up grains from the ground in the field, busy and dedicated. Natural light, detailed feathers, storybook art.
The pigeon drinking water from a small puddle and then flying towards a simple birdhouse or nest as evening approaches. Warm sunset light.
Dramatic scene of a sudden strong storm with dark clouds, wind blowing the banyan tree leaves, and rain starting to fall. Tense atmosphere.
The crow sitting on a branch, looking unbothered by the rain, eyes half-closed, lazy expression. Raindrops falling around him.
The pigeon talking to the crow, looking concerned, pointing away with its wing. The wind is picking up. Expressive characters.
The crow laughing at the pigeon, staying stubbornly on the branch. The pigeon looks worried and ready to fly away.
The storm intensifies, lightning in the sky, a large branch of the banyan tree snapping and falling. Chaotic and dangerous moment.
The crow flying away in panic as the branch breaks, feathers ruffled by the wind, looking scared. High action shot.
The pigeon safe inside a small, sturdy rock cave or crevice, watching the storm from inside. Warm and protected feeling.
The pigeon looking out from the cave at the wet, tired crow. The pigeon has a wise and helpful expression. Moral of the story moment.
The crow with its head bowed in shame or humility, standing near the pigeon's cave, looking repentant. The storm is subsiding. Happy ending.
